clinical_study.brief_title: An Outcomes Assessment of the Utility of Belladerm Acellular Dermal Allograft in Ocular Lower Lid Retraction Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Non-Cadaveric Human Acellular Dermal Tissue (BellaDermÂ®) in Lower Eyelid Retraction Repair

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to Evaluate the efficacy and longevity of a Human-derived, non-cadaveric, acellular dermal implant (BellaDerm) as a posterior spacer graft in the correction of lower eyelid retraction, taking into consideration issues associated with the use of acelular dermis such as contraction and potential regression of repairs.

detailed_description.textblock: To Evaluate the efficacy and longevity of a Human-derived, non-cadaveric, acellular dermal implant (BellaDerm) as a posterior spacer graft in the correction of lower eyelid retraction, taking into consideration issues associated with the use of acelular dermis such as contraction and potential regression of repairs.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Pre and Post operative margin reflex distance 2 MRD 2
primary_outcome.description: Pre and postoperative margin reflex distance 2 (MRD2) and inferior scleral show (ISS) was measured of each eyelid, and success was defined as a positive eyelid elevation and decrease in inferior scleral show. Long- term stability beyond 12 months was evaluated.

other_outcome.description: Pre and post operative margin reflex distance 2 (MRD2) and inferior scleral show (ISS) where measured for each eyelid elevation and decrease in inferior scleral show.

arm_group.description: Non Cadaveric human BellaDerm Acellular dermal tissue

intervention.intervention_name: Non Cadaveric Human Acellular Dermal Tissue

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lower eyelid retraction, defined as inferior displacement of the lower eyelid margin with inferior scleral show, may be asymptomatic
- May have ocular irritation including foreign body sensation, burning, photophobia and tearing.
- May have aesthetically unsatisfactory eyelid appearance.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a condition that would be contraindicated to surgery
